name: Holiday Inn Leicester

reviews.text: We stayed holiday inn and just came back. The hotel was average, nothing bad or especially good. Clean enough. We had a car and came for a wedding. So we did not need to go anywhere, so we did not need to be so central. We also stayed at Hilton in Leicester. It was better hotel than this. If you are with children, it is better to stay at Hilton. Without kids, maybe better to stay at holiday inn.
reviews.title: It is good if you want to be central

reviews.text: Have recently stayed at this hotel, which from the outside does not look that appealing.
reviews.title: Better than it seems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is only a 3 star rated hotel, but the rooms are definitely 4 star - Very comfortable and well equipped, even down to the choice of soft or firm pillows.
reviews.title: The slowest service for an unnecessary pricey hotel!

reviews.text: Food is good, and the buffet breakfast is also well managed and works well.
reviews.title: cant fault it

reviews.text: Staff all pleasant and helpful, I was at a company function which was being overseen by Architek, I think that is right, who was most helpful.
reviews.title: Very Central

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night with wife and two babies. Its the 2nd time we have stayed here and the 2nd time that both kids have come out with a rash on their faces - think it is the detergent used on the bed sheets. Wont be staying again for that reason. Other than that, it is an OK hotel. Nothing about it makes me want to rate it higher than just "ok".
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.text: We stayed here in a family room on a sunday night. We were on the top floor with great views over the city, this kept the children amused for a good hour alone! The pool is great, although a little on the cool side. Jacuzzi, steam room etc are a nice extra.
reviews.title: For the price, perfectly exceptable.

reviews.text: No doubt, the rooms could do with a referb, although ours was clean and tidy so I can't complain.
reviews.title: Great stay, shame about parking

reviews.text: All in all, if you can get a good deal, its a good place to stay in a central location.
reviews.title: Holiday inn Leicester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is what you would expect from a Holiday Inn, modern, clean and friendly service.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Well Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, cannot fault this hotel. Thought the staff we're very friendly, clean and spacious rooms, found the beds to be very comfortable. Enjoyed the use of the leisure facilities, including swimming pool, sauna and steam room. Although the Jacuzzi was currently out of use. Even though check in was 2pm we were able to check in a little earlier as our room was ready. Had no real issues, although I personally find the breakfast to be a little pricey at £14.95, if its worth it I'm not sure as I chose to eat elsewhere. Location is another plus, just 2 minutes walk to town and all areas to eat.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: The rooms are old and need updating. Bed was uncomfortable. AC was VERY noisy. Also noise from outside, so AC on or off its very noisy.
reviews.title: In need of updating

reviews.text: A very poor holiday inn.
reviews.title: Tired and Old

reviews.text: I didn't go to breakfast, so can't comment.
reviews.title: Great staff and location, but could do with sprucing up

reviews.text: Check in and check out we're fine.
reviews.title: Let Down by Head Office

reviews.text: Where do I start? Ok positives first.. Great staff as ever and as you'd expect from an IHG hotel so good marks there. Bad points .. Rooms are in desperate need of updating. AC is very noisy, bathroom very very tired, fixtures and fittings all tired. Oh, and no towels in the room - which I discovered AFTER I got out of the shower...
reviews.title: Very tired hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night for leisure and the experience was a positive one. I arrived at about midday, earlier than the normal check-in time of 2pm. From past experiences some hotels become awkward when checking in early. However, this was not a problem here - the courteous reception lady assigned me a room and was given the key card.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

reviews.text: The location is perfect for walking into the city centre and the Highcross Mall and Restaurants - 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Great stay, highly recommended

reviews.text: The room was very large with a huge queen size bed. Both the room and bathroom was clean. A 32 inch LCD TV complemented the room.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Guests also have access to the on-site Spirit gym, pool, sauna and jacuzzi which is an added bonus. All facilities here were clean.
reviews.title: Really good hotel !

description: Holiday Inn hotel in Leicester is located in the centre of this up & coming City in the heart of England. With good road links from M1/M69 and A50. The hotel is minutes from Leicester train station. This City Centre hotel is ideally placed for the historic, cultural, sporting and tourist attractions such as the Leicester Tigers Rugby Club, Leicester City Football Club, Highcross Shopping Centre, De Montfort Concert Hall, National Space Centre, Conkers, Twycross Zoo, De Montfort University and Leicester University. See our packages page for further details on our fantastic family Stay, Play & Explore packageOur 188 guests rooms including Executive, Accessible, Family rooms & 2 Long Stay Suites meet both the needs of the leisure and corporate traveller with High-Speed internet access and 'Kids Stay & Eat Free*'. The unique Restaurant & Bar, & the 'Spirit' Leisure Club, with swimming pool, enhance Holiday Inn Leicesters' hotel's facilities. There is limited evening dining in the Vermont Restaurant throughout December. Please contact hotel for more information. *Terms & Conditions apply.
